page.title: 07Landscape
page.content: The landscape in our block is in general very flat with only the moraine-hill at Preesall to vary the scene.There are few trees apart from those which have been left to shelter the farm-houses.Wind is a feature of this coastal zone.The views out from our area are,we think, some of the best and most varied of any.We can see the docks of Fleetwood together with all the leisure-craft in the Wyre as well as the industrial complex at I.C.I. to the west.To the north we have the whole vista of the Lake District which is breath-taking,west from Walney Island,Barrow-in-Furness to the Penines,the top of Igleborough just visible in the east.Looking to the east we can see the Bowland Hills which form a pleasant contrast to the water and sands of Morecambe Bay with its mountinous back-drop.
